abstract.p: Melvin Rosenberg letter on mankind's desire to conquer space (Feb 4 article)

block.p: My advice regarding the essay ''We May Conquer Space; It Will Never Be Easy'' (Feb. 4) is to take heart and seek out solutions to comparatively simpler, safer, more urgent and less expensive challenges.

My advice regarding the essay ''We May Conquer Space; It Will Never Be Easy'' (Feb. 4) is to take heart and seek out solutions to comparatively simpler, safer, more urgent and less expensive challenges.

And best of all, they can all be achieved with at least one foot on the ground at all times. They are cancer, AIDS, mental disease, malnutrition, water, soil and air pollution, social hatreds, war, ignorance, slavery, global warming, pollution from atomic waste and garbage, tyrannical nationalism and overpopulation.

This is just a brief sampling of the real and urgent challenges facing our very existence on this planet without concerning ourselves as to whether life exists or can be maintained on one or more of our sister constellations. This is a time for us to look at what resides beneath our feet, and not to gaze romantically at the stars.
